draws the y-labels on the specified x-position

This behavior relies on the deprecated * {@link Fragment#setUserVisibleHint(boolean)} API. Use * {@link #BEHAVIOR_RESUME_ONLY_CURRENT_FRAGMENT} to switch to its replacement, * {@link FragmentTransaction#setMaxLifecycle}.
Tint to apply to tab icons, if present. This can be a color state list or a color.
eturns the bottom padding of this view. If there are inset and enabled * scrollbars, this value may include the space required to display the * scrollbars as well.
Draws the IMarker on the given position on the screen with the given Canvas object.

Manually render this view (and all of its children) to the given Canvas. * The view must have already done a full layout before this function is * called. When implementing a view, implement * {@link #onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas)} instead of overriding this method. * If you do need to override this method, call the superclass version. * * @param canvas The Canvas to which the View is rendered.
The x-value to highlight
the x-position (pixels) on which this highlight object was last drawn
Class for describing width and height dimensions in some arbitrary * unit. Replacement for the android.Util.SizeF which is available only on API >= 21. */
pos X
translate to the correct position and draw
This is the X position at which the marker wants to be drawn. * You can adjust the offset conditionally based on this argument.
get Offset For Drawing At Point
The offset for drawing at the specific `point`. This allows conditional adjusting of the Marker position. * If you have no adjustments to make, return getOffset().

The desired (general) offset you wish the IMarker to have on the x- and y-axis. * By returning x: -(width / 2) you will center the IMarker horizontally. * By returning y: -(height / 2) you will center the IMarker vertically. */
By returning x: -(width / 2) you will center the IMarker horizontally. * By returning y: -(height / 2) you will center the IMarker vertically.

The desired (general) offset you wish the IMarker to have on the x- and y-axis. * By returning x: -(width / 2) you will center the IMarker horizontally. * By returning y: -(height / 2) you will center the IMarker vertically.
if true, value highlightning is enabled
用来设置marker和长按的时候的指示hignlight的距离
Contains information needed to determine the highlighted value.

Sets extra spacing for `axisMinimum` to be added to automatically calculated `axisMinimum`
the width of the bars on the x-axis, in values (not pixels)
Sets the width each bar should have on the x-axis (in values, not pixels). * Default 0.85f
ets extra spacing for `axisMinimum` to be added to automatically calculated `axisMinimum`
Each corner receives * two radius values [X, Y]. The corners are ordered top-left, top-right, * bottom-right, bottom-left
Array of 8 values, 4 pairs of [X,Y] radii

Sets a new data object for the chart. The data object contains all values * and information needed for displaying.

more calls potentially to save()
now the canvas is back in the same state it was before the initial * // call to save().
Efficient way to pop any calls to save() that happened after the save * count reached saveCount. It is an error for saveCount to be less than 1.
